abstract: Brooking Institution is issuing two studies detailing for first time growing online menace of sextortion, in which hackers steal nude photographs of person to extort more sexually explicit content or other goods; studies find phenomenon, which has thousands of victims to date, is not defined clearly in federal or state laws, even those governing non-consensual pornography, and is not being monitored or addressed by any government agency.
lead_paragraph: The Brookings Institution is releasing studies on sextortion, in which a perpetrator uses nude photographs to demand explicit content or other goods.

headline.main: As ‘Sextortion’ Proliferates, Victims Find Precarious Place in Legal System
headline.print_headline: As ‘Sextortion’ Proliferates, Victims Find Precarious Place in Legal System

snippet: The Brookings Institution is releasing studies on sextortion, in which a perpetrator uses nude photographs to demand explicit content or other goods.
